title: Update regarding LuxeBrands
story_body:
LUXURY RETAIL SECTOR FACES WIDESPREAD SUPPLY CONSTRAINTS AS INVENTORY SHORTAGES INTENSIFY

NEW YORK, March 15, 2024, 09:47 EST - The luxury consumer goods sector is experiencing significant supply chain disruptions affecting inventory availability across multiple retail channels, with LuxeBrands Incorporated (NYSE: LUXE) among the companies impacted by the industry-wide shortage.

Manufacturing delays originating in European production facilities have created bottlenecks affecting the delivery of premium consumer products to North American markets. The disruptions stem from component shortages and logistics complications that have persisted since the first quarter of 2024.

Industry data indicates that luxury goods retailers are reporting inventory levels approximately 23 percent below normal seasonal benchmarks for the current period. The shortages affect multiple product categories including leather goods, timepieces, and ready-to-wear apparel.

LuxeBrands Incorporated disclosed in a regulatory filing dated March 14, 2024, that the company is experiencing delays in receiving merchandise from third-party suppliers. The filing stated that delivery timelines have extended by an average of four to six weeks compared to standard lead times.

The supply constraints are not isolated to LuxeBrands Incorporated. Competitor firms including Prestige Retail Group and Continental Luxury Holdings have similarly reported inventory challenges in recent weeks. Industry analysts note that the disruptions affect approximately 60 percent of luxury retailers operating in the North American market.

Transportation bottlenecks at major European ports have compounded manufacturing delays. Shipping data from March 2024 shows container volumes for luxury goods decreased 18 percent compared to the same period in 2023.

Raw material shortages, particularly in specialized leather and textile supplies, have further constrained production capacity. European tanneries reported operating at 72 percent capacity as of March 1, 2024, according to industry trade group data.

LuxeBrands Incorporated operates 347 retail locations across North America and maintains an e-commerce platform serving customers in 28 countries. The company reported net revenues of 2.8 billion dollars for fiscal year 2023.

The company has not issued guidance revisions related to the supply disruptions. LuxeBrands Incorporated is scheduled to report first quarter 2024 earnings on April 23, 2024.

Industry observers indicate that resolution of the supply constraints may require eight to twelve weeks depending on improvements in manufacturing output and logistics capacity.
